question_content.barrons:question: Infuriated by what he considered blatantly (i) ___________ attacks in the press, the candidate delivered a lengthy (ii) __________ against biased reporting.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
partisan, harangue.

The key word here is infuriated or angry. A harangue is a sharp verbal attack, a bitter tirade or diatribe. The angry candidate responds to what he considers partisan or biased attacks by attacking those who have attacked him.

Surreptitious is incorrect. Surreptitious means hidden or stealthy. It makes no sense in the context of a blatant attack.

Warranted is incorrect. Warranted means justified. It makes no sense in the context.

Prejudice is incorrect. Prejudice is a preconceived opinion, usually an unfavorable one. It makes no sense in the context.

Rhetoric is incorrect. Rhetoric is the art or study of the use of languages. It makes no sense in the context.
